sect2.title: Support for &slsa; hosts
sect2.para: Consult the following support and compatibility matrix to make sure that the desired host system and container combination is compatible and supported.

In most scenarios, all &slea; containers are expected to be interoperable if the application or its dependencies do not interact directly with kernel version-specific data structures (ioctl, /proc, /sys, routing, iptables, nftables, eBPF, etc.) or modules (KVM, OVS, SystemTap, etc.). Support for ioctl and access to /proc is limited to the most common scenarios needed by unprivileged uses.

sect2.title: Support for non-&slsa; hosts
sect2.para: While SUSE-based containers are fully supported, issues in the host environment must be handled by the host environment vendor. SUSE supports components that are part of the SUSE base containers. Packages from SUSE repositories are also supported. Additional components and applications in the containers are not covered by SUSE support. A &sle; subscription is required for building derived containers.
Containers based on &sls; 12 SP5 and &sls; 15 (all Service Packs) are supported according to their official lifecycles and the following table.

sect1.title: Support plans
sect1.para: There are three guiding principles of &suse; container support.

listitem.para: The container image lifecycle follows the lifecycle of the related products.
For example, &slsa; &productnumber; container images follow the &slsa; &productnumber; lifecycle.
Container release status also matches the status of the related product.
For example, if &slsa; &productnumber; is in Alpha, Beta, RC, or GA stage, the related containers have the same release status.
Containers are built using the packages from the related products.
For example, &slsa; &productnumber; container images are built using the same packages as the main &slsa; &productnumber; release.

sect1.para: For further information, refer to the Product Support Lifecycle page and the documentation available for specific container images on &suse; Registry.
Container images can have different support status, and they can have limited support. Refer to the appropriate &suse; Registry page for the further information about a specific container image.

sect1.title: Supported containers on SUSE host environments
sect1.para: The following support options (tiers) apply to &sls; containers on &suse; host environments.

listitem.para: Containers delivered by &suse; are fully supported. This applies to both the container and host environment as well as all products under support. This includes both general support and Long Term Service Pack Support (LTSS).

varlistentry.term: Containers delivered by partners with an agreement ensuring a joint engineering collaboration

listitem.para: This tier targets important Independent Software Vendors (ISVs). Partner containers with a joint engineering collaboration agreement are fully supported. This applies to both the container and host environment as well as all products under support (both general, as well as LTSS) covered by the agreement. Products not covered by the agreement fall under Tier Three.
The &suse; container host environment is fully supported. However the container vendor is responsible for handling issues related to third-party containers they maintain.

sect1.title: Supported container host environments
sect1.para: The support options (tiers) covered below apply to the following container options:

listitem.para: Third-party container environments derived from the &slea; base containers
This tier applies to &sls;. Both the containers and host environments delivered by &suse; are fully supported as well as all products under support. This includes both general support and LTSS.

varlistentry.term: Third-party vendors with an agreement ensuring a joint engineering collaboration

listitem.para: Partner containers and host environments with a joint engineering collaboration agreement are fully supported. This applies to both the container and host environment as well as all products under support (both general and LTSS) covered by the agreement.

varlistentry.term: Selected third-party vendors with no agreement

listitem.para: This tier targets environments delivered by selected third-party vendors. While &suse;-based containers are fully supported, issues in the host environment must be handled by the host environment vendor. &suse; supports components that come from the &suse; base containers. Packages from &suse; repositories are also supported. Additional components and applications in the containers are not covered by &suse; support. A &slea; subscription is required for building a derived container.

Any container host environment not mentioned in the support tiers above has limited support. Details can be discussed with the &suse; Support Team, who might triage the issue and recommend alternative solutions. In any other case, issues in the host environment must be handled by the host environment vendor.
